page.title: 20LOCAL DIALECTS
page.content:
There are not only two well known dialects of English, namely, the broad Herefordshire and Gloucestershire which can be aligned to the Parishes of The Lea,Weston-under-Penyard,Hope Mansell and Aston Ingham in Herefordshire and the Parish of Longhope in Gloucestershire but there remain the Parishes of Mitcheldean and Drybrook in Glos. which have a marked Forest of Dean dialect which is not understood by those in the neighbouring parishes.The following examples spelt phonically will clarify beum thikum yud beast are you thick one head are you
dree week three week (ends).i.e. a fortnight. There is very little movement of the lips indicating an origin associated with suspicion of the foreigner inborn
